output.dependency: The identifier (first column) uniquely determines the title of the film (second column), indicating that each film has a unique identifier.
The title of the film (second column) is related to its release year (third column), as each film title corresponds to a specific year.

The release date (fourth column) alongside the country of release (tenth column) indicates that the release date specifies where the film was released, with the country being part of the release context.

The directors (fifth column) and producers (sixth column) are related; each film has specific individuals responsible for directing and producing, which implies that the directors listed directly correlate with the producers of the film.
The cast of the film (seventh column) includes elements from the crew (sixth column), suggesting that the actors in the sixth column may have also been involved in the film's production.
The genre of the film (fifteenth column) can suggest thematic elements relevant to places mentioned (fourteenth column), indicating that certain genres might often be set in specific locations.

The number of user and critic reviews (thirteenth column) could relate to the average rating of the film (twelfth column), suggesting that more reviews may influence or correlate with a higher or lower rating.
